titleStmt.title: Receipts 340 AD
titleStmt.author: Aurelius Kopres, son of Paulos, collector

msContents.summary: Receipts for deliveries of wheat by Atisios, Antiourios, and Kastor

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
Written by 5 different hands, all regular and fast
35 lines of writing divided into two cols. which are well-preserved

origin.persName: Aurelius Iulius, son of Severinus, collector

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 8 in Bell

div.ab: Aurelil Kopres son of Paulos and lulius son of Severinus and their partners, receivers of grain for the city, to Aurelius Atisios son of Leonides, kephalaiotes of Karanis, greeting. We have received from you for the twelfth indiction for the account of villagers, eight (and) a twelfth artabas of clean wheat, art. 8 1/12 only. (M2) I, Kopres, have signed. (M3) I, Ploution, have signed. (M 1) In the consulate of Septimius Acydinus the most illustrious prefect of the sacred praetorium and of Populonius Proculus the most illustrious, Phamenoth 25.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. VII 148 Plate, P.Col. VII, Microfiche 1. The date in the edition should be corrected to 22/3/340 AD, BL X p. 41.
